name: lexical-api-asymmetry
description: Lexical framework has hidden API asymmetry where read() returns values but update() returns void
why_its_good: Non-obvious framework constraint that catches experienced developers
TypeScript surfaced the issue but didn't explain it
Pattern extends to other frameworks with mutation/query distinction
Documents practical constraint affecting code organization

engineering: editor.update(callback) returns void regardless of callback return
This affects refactoring patterns and code organization
meta: Query operations return values for composition
API asymmetry is a design pattern worth documenting

expected_detection.should_identify: API asymmetry between mutation and query operations
expected_detection.should_propose: Document this pattern for future Lexical work

eval_criteria.recall: Must mention update/read asymmetry or void return
eval_criteria.precision: Should recognize this as intentional API design, not a bug
eval_criteria.signal_detection: Should catch the mutation vs query pattern
